articles.title: ANALYSIS-South America, battered by COVID-19, now winning global vaccination race
articles.description: Brazil, the largest country in Latin America, saw its COVID-19 death toll rise to the second-highest in the world, while Argentina and Peru reported some of the heaviest death per capita figures anywhere. But in recent months, despite patchy health services and lower income levels than in Europe or the United States, the region has emerged as a surprise winner in the vaccination rate.
articles.content:
Throughout much of 2020 and early 2021, South America was ground zero in the global fight against COVID-19.
Oxygen ran low in Peru. Gravediggers worked through the night in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Bodies were stuffed into shipping containers in Guayaquil,... [4649 chars]

articles.title: Dominic Thiem pulls out of Australian Open with wrist injury
articles.description: Thiem will start his 2022 season in South America at the Cordoba Open in Argentina at the end of January.
articles.content:
Dominic Thiem has pulled out of next month’s Australian Open owing to a long-standing wrist injury, the former world number three said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Australian Open 2022: Nadia Podoroska out of Melbourne Park event
articles.description: Argentina’s Nadia Podoroska is out of next month’s Australian Open because of physical issues that plagued her this year as player withdrawals begin to mount.
articles.content:
A sixth top-100 women’s player is out of the Australian Open as the injury toll starts to bite the Melbourne Park event.

articles.title: Argentina Braces For New COVID Wave As Cases Rise To Highest In Almost 6 Months
articles.description: Confirmed COVID19 cases in Argentina almost doubled on Monday from Friday to 20,263 new infections, according to the country's health ministry, the highest daily tally in almost 6 months as the Omicron variant spreads around the world.
